main_definition: RSS stands for 'Really Simple Syndication' or 'Rich Site Summary', which is a type of web feed that allows users to access updates to online content in a standardized format.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A software program used to fetch and display RSS feeds from various websites
meanings_and_examples.example: I use an RSS reader like Feedly to stay updated on my favorite news sites.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The abbreviation for 'Really Simple Syndication' or 'Rich Site Summary', which is a type of web feed that allows users to access updates to online content
meanings_and_examples.example: When I want to keep up with my favorite blogs, I use an RSS reader to get the latest posts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The file format used for distributing and synchronizing structured data such as feeds or news headlines from one site to another
meanings_and_examples.example: I subscribed to this website's feed so that I can receive updates whenever they post new content.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A type of web feed format used by websites, blogs and other data publishers to provide updated content in a standardized XML format
meanings_and_examples.example: I installed the RSS plugin on my browser so I can easily access updates from all my favorite websites.
